strings.Value: [Buy a sword for Valerie] "I want you to always smile like you are now."
{n}You notice Valerie eyeing one of the blades in the vendor's stall, her eyes shining with almost childlike admiration. She can't seem to tear her gaze away from it.{/n}

"See the proof mark on this sword? It belongs to the master who supplied the training swords to my first swordplay instructor. The first sword I ever held had this mark â€” I shall likely remember this symbol to the day I die. I never thought I would see this proof mark again." {n}Valerie smiles, her eyes hazy with memories.{/n}

"Oh, stop. It would be... silly. The gear I have now is much better and more reliable than what I had while learning swordplay. The swordsmith would hardly be pleased to know his work was just lying about when it could be loyally serving someone else."

{n}Valerie blushes, embarrassed but happy, as she decisively places her hand on yours as you reach for your coin purse.{/n} "Thank you, but that is completely unnecessary. The swordsmith would not be pleased to know his work was just lying about when it could be loyally serving someone else."

{n}Valerie smiles softly.{/n} "I was just happy to remember those days and have the chance to share the memory with you. I rarely do this. Probably only with you." {n}She casts a final glance at the sword, then steps away from the stall.{/n}
"So, what might you be interested in?"
